name: 數位藝術專題研究
description: 課程包括理論闡述、數位藝術與電腦藝術的關係、Collage art、Constructive art、3D造形與動畫的研討與試作，並包含設計上的應用，使用軟體有CorelDraw、Photo-Paint、True Space、Front Page
goals: 從美學分析與實際製作來探討數位藝術與設計的風貌與可能性，讓學生對數位藝術與設計有深刻的體認與表現能力
syllabus:
本課程將以「數位美學」為核心命題，討論當代科技的發展已經改變了藝術表現的形式，從創作過程、美學思維到典藏維護都面臨到觀念的挑戰與更新。儘管至今已有超過數以萬計的藝術家、藝術團體與博物館都已經利用數位科技來作為影像意念傳達的工具，然而在理論與美學上的探討卻相當薄弱。本課程主要藉由當代數位藝術的創作作品來討論數位藝術應有的論述觀點與美學內涵。因此，本課程主要涵蓋三大面向的探討：第一、探討數位藝術與傳統藝術在理論論述與美學思維上的異同。第二、數位藝術的特質與應有表現。第三、數位虛擬映展空間對觀影人的意義。從這三大方面中，本課程試圖提供學生一套完整的觀看數位藝術之觀點，並協助學生了解數位藝術的創作。課程內容包括：

1.  概念釐清：原生數位與數位化
2.  歷史發展：從機械複製到數位複製、數位原創
3.  本質論述：科技藝術本體、身體與影像的互動關係、時間與空間的感知
4.  美學論述：新數位影像與美學轉向、後媒材時代的美學、科技作為媒材
5.  議題辯證：文字與影像的辯證、真實與虛擬的論辯、敘事與破敘事的論證
6.  實例分析：早期案例、晚近案例

This course is aimed at instilling in students a comprehensive knowledge of New Media Arts as an influential force in human history. Students should gain an understanding how new media arts have developed and evolved into their present form as a way to transmit information and communicate. This knowledge base should offer students a framework to place their own future practice in. As New Media Arts have always developed alongside technological developments, the history of related technology will be one focus of the course alongside the analysis of how information has been communicated and transmitted in terms of content, aesthetics and cultural geographies over time. 

The course entitled seminar in new media arts will be an introductory course and aims on three parts of studying the subject. 1. Discussing the most fundamental key concept of new media arts from philosophical, aesthetic and theoretical perspectives. 2. Elaborating different artistic categories of new media arts from digital photography, digital audio-visual expression, interactive design and installation, sound and sound installation to newly established interdisciplinary digital performance. The course will also includes the most recent social design concept. 3. Visiting relevant exhibitions. Field studies will be also conducted by course instructor. The student who attempts to take this course should engage with reading materials, in class discussion and group presentation as well as assignment for individual.
